sources.title: "Crossroads" (1928) Classic Japanese Silent Drama
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation       "Crossroads" is an intense drama starring Akiko Chihaya, Junosuke Bando, Yukiko Ogawa, Ippei Soma, Yoshie Nakagawa and others. A young man suffers immensely when a rival publicly humiliates him in front of the woman that he loves.     The film features the renowned director Teinosuke Kinugasa.     This Japanese classic has a lot to offer to those film lovers that appreciate intense high-quality gut-wrenching drama. The film has courtesans, love, fear, hate, illusions, delusions, fantasies, agony, death, murder.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. metadata.Plot: After falling in love with a courtesan, Rikiya is blinded by ash during a fight in a brothel. Believing the blindness permanent and his opponent dead, Rikiya goes back home to his sister. Okiku, desperate to protect her brother who thinks himself a murderer, wants to sacrifice herself for him and become a prostitute to pay for Rikiya's treatment.
metadata.Actors: Akiko Chihaya, Junosuke Bandô, Yukiko Ogawa
